description: Potato wedges seasoned with aromatic spices and oven-baked or deep-fried until the outside is golden and crispy while the inside remains fluffy and tender. A universally loved snack or side dish.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: While potatoes ('viazi') are a common vegetable in Uganda, the preparation of 'wedges' is a more modern, globally influenced dish. They have become very popular in urban areas, at casual eateries, and as a home-cooked treat, especially for younger generations. They represent the adaptation of international fast-food styles using locally available ingredients.

ingredients.name: Large Potatoes
ingredients.notes: Russet or any starchy variety, scrubbed clean

ingredients.name: Vegetable Oil
ingredients.notes: For baking. For frying, use 4 cups.

steps.instruction: Scrub the potatoes clean. You can peel them or leave the skin on for extra texture and nutrients. Cut each potato in half lengthwise, then cut each half into 3-4 wedges, depending on the size of the potato.
Place the potato wedges in a large mixing bowl. Add the vegetable oil, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme/oregano, salt, black pepper, and optional cornstarch.
Toss the wedges thoroughly until they are evenly coated with the oil and spice mixture.
Arrange the wedges in a single layer on a large baking sheet, ensuring they are not touching. This allows them to crisp up instead of steam.
Bake for 25-35 minutes, flipping the wedges halfway through, until they are golden brown, crispy on the outside, and tender on the inside.

cooking_indicators.texture: Crispy exterior, soft and fluffy interior.

steps.instruction: Remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

alternative_methods.name: Deep Frying Method
alternative_methods.description: For a more traditional 'kukaanga' (frying) approach. Heat 4 cups of vegetable oil in a deep pot to 180째C (350째F). Fry the seasoned wedges in batches for 5-7 minutes until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a snack with tomato ketchup, chili sauce, or a garlic mayo dip. They also make a fantastic side dish for grilled chicken, beef burgers, or fish.
